entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 120 to 180 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Intensities generally less than 10 mm per hour, but may reach 15 mm per hour during Monday afternoon and evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 70 to 110 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h about hills and ranges. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 50 to 70 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, especially about eastern Wairarapa and the Tararua Range. Intensities of 15 to 20 mm per hour about the hills and ranges this morning. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been decreased to Low.
